Line 14: Line 14:
CMC media is sold by [[HP]], [[Imation]], [[Memorex]], [[Philips]], [[TDK]], [[Verbatim Corporation|Verbatim]], [[Staples]], [[Office Depot]] brand and many [[Original equipment manufacturer|OEM]] brands. Mr. Data is CMC's own brand. They have CD-R factories in Taiwan, China (Memorex, HP, Philips, TDK) and Hong Kong (Memorex, Philips).
CMC media is sold by [[HP]], [[Imation]], [[Memorex]], [[Philips]], [[TDK]], [[Verbatim Corporation|Verbatim]], [[Staples]], [[Office Depot]] brand and many [[Original equipment manufacturer|OEM]] brands. Mr. Data is CMC's own brand. They have CD-R factories in Taiwan, China (Memorex, HP, Philips, TDK) and Hong Kong (Memorex, Philips).
â
According to online media enthusiast communities, CMC Magnetics is reputed to be one of the worst manufacturers of CD and DVD media on the market.[http://www.cdrlabs.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=21234] CMC Magnetics manufactures mostly "value" media according to digitalFAQ, their reputation for quality is almost universally low and the media is not recommended if durability or reliability is a concern. [http://www.digitalfaq.com/media/dvdmedia.htm] Many Quality/Stress scans by commercial software like [[Nero (computer software)|Nero CD-DVD Speed]] reveal the media to be among the worst performing[http://www.cdrlabs.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=22986][http://forums.hardwarezone.com.sg/showthread.php?t=1099765&page=4], showing extremely unpredictable jitter and many [[cyclic redundancy check|CRC]] errors.
+
According to online media enthusiast communities, CMC Magnetics is reputed to be one of the worst manufacturers of CD and DVD media on the market.[http://www.cdrlabs.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=21234] CMC Magnetics manufactures mostly "value" media according to digitalFAQ, their reputation for quality is almost universally low and the media is not recommended if durability or reliability is a concern. [http://www.digitalfaq.com/media/dvdmedia.htm] Many Quality/Stress scans by commercial software like [[Nero (software suite)|Nero CD-DVD Speed]] reveal the media to be among the worst performing[http://www.cdrlabs.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=22986][http://forums.hardwarezone.com.sg/showthread.php?t=1099765&page=4], showing extremely unpredictable jitter and many [[cyclic redundancy check|CRC]] errors.
